title: 111_hr3195
content: The Act is titled the "National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry Act of 2009". The Congress finds the lack of centralized data on national mortgage foreclosure rates and the need for a system to collect and disclose such information. The purpose of the Act is to establish a National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry. The National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry aims to provide timely mortgage performance information for government agencies to monitor trends, identify issues, make decisions, conduct research, and evaluate the housing market in the US. It also meets reporting needs of the Federal Housing Finance Agency. SEC. 3. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REPORTED BY LENDER AT LOAN ORIGINATION. Section 304(b) of the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 is amended to include a unique identification number for each mortgage loan, the appraised value of the residence at the time of origination, and a classification of the loan structure by terms such as interest rate and repayment terms. The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 is amended to include a unique identification number for each mortgage loan, the appraised value of the residence at origination, and a classification of the loan structure by terms such as interest rate. Additionally, it requires disclosure of the lowest interest rate for which the borrower qualified without payment of discount points to identify eligible mortgagors for prime loans provided subprime loans. The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 is amended to include a unique identification number for each mortgage loan, the appraised value of the residence at origination, and a classification of the loan structure by terms such as interest rate. Additionally, there is a requirement for reporting of information by servicers. Section 304 of the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 is amended to require lending institutions, including mortgage loan servicers, to submit specific information to the appropriate agency if certain events occur during the loan term. This information includes the year the loan originated and a unique identifier number for the loan. The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 requires lending institutions to report specific information to the appropriate agency if certain events occur during the loan term, such as loan modifications and disclosures for new loans. The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 mandates reporting loan events like delinquency, foreclosure, loan modifications, and completion of foreclosure. Data is collected by the Board in collaboration with the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The Board, in conjunction with the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, will gather additional information on mortgage loans, including data from loan servicers, to enhance the public home mortgage information system. The term 'servicer' refers to the entity responsible for receiving borrower payments and managing escrowed amounts for taxes and insurance. The Board, along with the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, will collect more data on mortgage loans, including information from loan servicers, to improve the public home mortgage information system. The term 'servicer' refers to the entity handling borrower payments and managing escrowed amounts for taxes and insurance. Payments required under the loan terms will be received from the borrower. The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 is amended to include a new section establishing the National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry. The Board will establish a National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry to compile information on mortgage loans for single-family housing, multifamily housing, and small farms. Quarterly reports will be submitted to Congress, the Secretary of the Treasury, and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development on the performance of outstanding mortgage loans in the United States. The Board will provide aggregate data on mortgage loans originated, defaults, and foreclosures in the United States by location. The data aims to assist in housing decisions and federal housing assistance. The accuracy of the data will be reviewed and certified by the Board. The Board will certify the accuracy of data in quarterly reports before making them publicly available. The Board will report to Congress on improving the registry. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Secretary of the Treasury, and Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will jointly submit a report to Congress within 18 months of the enactment of the Act. The report will outline additional actions or authority needed for the National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry to accurately determine foreclosure rates and evaluate Federal housing programs more effectively. The report will outline actions needed for the National Home Mortgage and Loan Performance Registry to evaluate mortgage lending practices and improve its function and purpose. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System must update regulations on home mortgage disclosure within 18 months of this Act's enactment.
